results.title: The Choice is yours (Industrial safety)
results.creator_credit: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions
results.brief_description: Considers the problems of industrial safety on civil engineering construction sites. Makes the point that it is not the obviously risky jobs and locations that cause the majority of accidents but simple carelessness. Reconstructs accidents, and stresses the value of goggles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions

results.title: The choice is yours
results.brief_description: Instructional film concerning water pollution and prevention. Appreciation for our water resources is stimulated first by tranquil scenes of nature as it was before the coming of man, then by exciting scenes featuring the many forms of water recreation man enjoys today. In stark contrast.. the diastrous effects of pollution. In the laboratories of a water resources commission the complexity of the problem is discussed and the procedures of water management agencies are described. The film ends with a dramatic abstract sequence where the choice between pure or polluted water is again presented, thus encouraging serious discussion of this vital part of our environment.

results.title: Chiostri e cortili
results.creator_credit: Ubaldo Magnachi and Istuto Nazionale Luce
results.brief_description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.

results.title: Chinese shadow play
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: The shadow-play is one of the most popular Chinese folk-arts; it appeared in China during the 10th century A.D. this film presents a shortened version of the traditional tale of the White Snake Lady, one of the most popular of all Chinese fairy tales. The figures are made from translucent parchment, (in China, from donkey skin) which is painted in delicate colors, and to which wires for manipulation are attached. The drama is performed by manipulating the figures behind an illuminated screen, to the accompaniment of Chinese drums, gongs, and cymbals; the melodramatic dialogue is spoken from behind the screen by the manipulators. Animation and demonstration by Pauline Benton. Narrated by Arvo Wirta.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wan-go Wen and China Film Enterprises of America

results.title: Hand puppets
results.creator_credit: Chang Chao-chun, Yu Cheh-kuang, Peking Television and Shanghai Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: Costumed hand and glove puppets of Yang Sheng, master puppeteer. Sheng spends long hours of study to create each character and these are brought to life by his superb technique and artistry. Using traditional and legendary Chinese characters and stories, Sheng is training a new generation of young people who demonstrate the production of a traditional play: “A Robe and a Beauty”, performed in full. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: [Chinese jade carving]
results.brief_description: The art of jade carving is a specialised and revered art in China. The film shows a skilled carver fashioning a rabbit out of jade. The five fundamental steps of jade carving as well as the tools used are demonstrated and described. The artistic and aesthetic values of jade are discussed and various properties of the material explained.

results.title: China - the red sons
results.creator_credit: Roger Whittaker and Roger Whittaker Films
results.brief_description: A tour of six Chinese cities in 1968 by a group of Australian and New Zealand students. Scenes of ordinary life and industry, and interviews with officials, students, Red Guards, foreign residents and others discussing the Cultural Revolution then in progress and the general situation, displaying the contrasting values of the visitors and their hosts. Narrated by Richard Oxenburgh.

results.title: China: land and the people
results.brief_description: Discusses the similarities and differences in climate, in topography, and in crops of North and South China. Explains that the population of China is greater than that of any other country. Emphasises the importance of agriculture to the Chinese and explains that the 20th century has brought a shift towards industrialisation.

results.title: China under communism
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The changes in China today (1959); China’s most critical social and economic problems, and her position in world strategy. To obtain this material, author, editor and foreign correspondent, John Strohm, who first visited China in 1937, returned there in 1958 and travelled over 7,500 miles almost entirely without restriction, observing and photographing all phases of Chinese life.

results.title: China and its people
results.brief_description: Discusses some of the changes which have taken place in China under Communist rule. Includes scenes of the Chinese people at work, at play, and at school.
